general_advisory: Keep your crop field free from weed to minimize the incidence of diseases and pests. Apply balanced and appropriate fertilizers according to cropâ€™s growth stage. Regular monitoring of the crop for incidence of pest and diseases should be done. Always apply recommended dose of pesticide in correct method. Install yellow sticky trap in vegetables at vegetative stage.

advisory: Weed Management: Apply herbicide Bensulfuron-methyl 0.6% + Pretilachlor 6% @ 4 kg at 3-5 days after transplanting mixed with equal quantity of sand and broadcast it uniformly in the field.
Harvest when 2/3rd to 3/4th of the pods have changed to brown color.
Leave harvested plant in field for sun drying for 3-5 days.
Thresh clean seed by beating pods or using Pullman thresher.
Sun dry clean seed to moisture content of 9-10% for safe storage.
Weed Management: Apply Quizalfop-ethyl 5% EC or Imazethapyr 10 SL @ 300 ml/acre at 20-25 DAS.
Pest Management: Spray Profenophos 50 EC for leaf eating caterpillar control.
Pest Management: Apply Chlorothalonil 75% WP or Hexaconazole 5% EC or Mancozeb 75% WP mixed with water for Tikka control.
Pest Management: Apply Metalaxyl M 4% + Mancozeb 64% WP or Copper Oxychloride 50% WP when White Rust symptoms appear.
Sucking pest complex control: Spray Acetamiprid 20% SP or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL mixed with water for control.
Powdery Mildew: Spray wettable sulphur @ 2g /ltr of water.
Irrigate crop at regular intervals.
Undertake hoeing, weeding and apply 45 kg urea/acre followed by irrigation.
Nutrient Management: Apply 27 kg urea + 25kg MOP at six-to-seven-week stage followed by irrigation.
Pest Management: Spray Fipronil 5% SC or Chlorpyriphos 20% EC or Thiamethoxam 25% WG for pest control.
Nutrient Management: Apply 27 kg urea at six-week stage followed by irrigation.
Pest Management: Spray Mancozeb 75% WP for Wilting control.
Pest Management: Apply Ethion 50% EC or Propargite 57 % EC mixed with water to control Mite infestation.
Increase concentrate in feed gradually before two months prior to calving to increase milk production.
Prevent animals from chill wind and floor to avoid sickness.
Contact veterinarians if running nose and persistent cough are noticed.
Prevent poultry birds from severe chill wind and cold floor.
Cover poultry house with thick polythene sheet to protect from cold wind.
Remove covering after 9 a.m. to allow sunlight.
